result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Traci J. Schmelzer

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:22 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Traci J. Schmelzer appeared by phone.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Traci J. Schmelzer.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Counsel state they are prepared to proceed to Preliminary hearing today

1W - KYLE MEZERA -Sworn by Court
exam. by Atty. Steiner
cross exam. by Atty. Kieler

State moves for bind over
Atty Kieler objects to bind over

Court finds probable cause - binds def. over for further proceeds

Information is filed at this time

Atty Kieler waives reading - def. enters a plea of "NOT GUILTY" as to each count
Court directs clerk to enter "NOT GUILTY" pleas to all 3 counts
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am. (Tentative trial dates of Dec. 20-22, 2022)
Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:56 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Traci J. Schmelzer appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Traci J. Schmelzer. 

Attorney Kieler is heard.  
Defendant waives time limits for holding Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney - Court appoints Atty. Ryan Kieler
Adjourned initial appearance on August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:03 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Traci J. Schmelzer in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on retaining an attorney. Defendant does not qualify for a public defender. Court will appoint an attorney. Wage assignment of $50.00 per month. Court grants the defendants petition. Commencing August 5th.  

Defendant is heard.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender's Office indicates that Ms. Schmelzer called their office this morning and they are not allowed to make changes to the eligibility forms once the information is given to them.  Ms. Schmelzer would be able to call back in 90 days to redo her eligibility form with the corrected information.  At this time,  she does not qualify for a public defender.

2:10 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Traci J. Schmelzer in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Def. provided a copy of the criminal complaint at this time
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

Court questions def. re: efforts to hire an attorney -response by def. - does not qualify for PD, has not tried to hire private counsel at this time.  States "RSW" is attempting to contact her
Court advises her that "RSW" is not subject to the order in this case - she needs to continue to not respond

Court advises def. to make efforts to hire an attorney - advises def. to file paperwork for court appointed attorney if she is unable to hire an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State Public Defender's Office received a phone call from Ms. Schmelzer and at this time she does not qualify for a public defender.

1:49 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Traci Jo Smelzer in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a signature bond unless defendant posted a cash bond. State requests conditions that defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with RSW. 

State is heard and corrects conditions to controlled substances. 
Defendant is heard.

Court orders that the $250.00 cash bond will remain.  Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with RSW.

Court advises right to an attorney. 

Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with RSW.
Bail/bond hearing on July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
